physics_world_draw_debug: This function will draw a representation of the physics world system of the room to help with debugging when you are having trouble getting the physics scene to work right. Sometimes the problem can be in the rendering part of your game, for example a sprite may be drawn at the wrong position or rotation, giving the appearance of incorrect physics, or it may be that your calculations are not correct. Either way, this function will help you to find and resolve the problem by drawing what is going on in your physics system. To do this, you need tell it which part of the system to draw, and this is done by passing a value created from the bits stored in various "flag" constants:
This shows the absolute bounding box of each fixture in relation to the room axis
This will show any fixtures that are currently in collision
This marks the center of mass of each fixture in the room
Shows the basic shapes that make up the fixtures in the room
This will draw each of the joints of all fixtures in the room
This shows the relative bounding box for the fixtures in the room
This shows the actual shapes that make up fixtures within the room
